actions.text: On agreeing to the Luetkemeyer amendment (A004) Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 182 (Roll no. 368).

description: Amendment expresses the sense of the Congress that States and local education agencies should maintain the rights and responsibilities of determining curriculum and assessments for elementary and secondary education.
purpose: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 113-158 to express the sense of the Congress that States and local education agencies should maintain the rights and responsibilities of determining curriculum and assessments for elementary and secondary education.
